availability.licence: This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0 International License.

correction.p: OCR generated transcript has not been corrected.

normalization.p: Only minor normalization where needed, if any, is indicated via markup.

punctuation.p: All punctuation marks in the source text have been retained, and are represented by appropriate Unicode code points.
Punctuation may be marked up with pc elements for clarification, but not exclusively.

quotation.p: All quotation marks have been retained, and are represented by appropriate Unicode code points.

hyphenation.p: Hyphenated words that appear at the end of a line have been retained. The hyphen, if present, is represented by the Unicode code point, and marked up with a pc element. The break="no" attribute on the lb element indicates that a single word is split across the lines.

interpretation.p: Dates, places, and names may be marked up, where useful.

LEWIS MOSHER FARMS
HAMILTON
Surrogate’s Court
MADISON COUNTY
IN THE MATTER OF THE LAST
WILL AND TESTAMENT OF
Lewis William Mosher
Deceased.
Letters Testamentary
STATE OF NEW YORK
Madison County
SURROGATE’S OFFIC SS.
Recorded on this 31st day
of January A.D., 1963
in Book No. 25 of Letters
Testamentary, at page 102 and
examined.
Clerk of the Surrogate's Court
The People of the State of New York:
BY THE GRACE OF GOD FREE AND INDEPENDENT
To all whom these presents may come or may concern
SEND GREETING:
KNOW YE, That at the village of Wampsvllle in
the town of and County of Madison, on the 31st
day of January, 1963, before ROSS PATANE, Esq. our
Surrogate of our County of Madison aforesaid, the last Will and Testament
late of the Village of Hamilton in said County, was approved,
and is now approved and allowed by us, and the said deceased having whilst living and at the
time of his death, goods, chattels or credits within this State by reason whereof the
proving and registering of said Will, and granting administration of all and singular the said
goods, chattels and credits; and also the auditing, allowing and finally discharging the accounts
thereof, doth belong unto us: And whereas the said deceased did in and by his Last
Will and Testament, constitute and appoint FREDERICK MOSHER, successor
executor thereof; And he having taken and subscribed an oath faith‐
fully and honestly to discharge the duties of such Successor/Executor.
NOW THEREFORE, We do grant unto you the said
FREDERICK MOSHER
full power by these presents, to administer and faithfully to dispose of the said goods, chattels and
credits, according to the provisions and directions of said Will, to ask, demand, recover and re‐
ceive the debts which unto the said deceased while living and at the time of his death,
did belong; and to pay the debts which the said deceased did owe, so far as such goods, chattels
and credits will thereunto extend, and the law requires Hereby requiring you to make or cause
to be made a true and perfect inventory of all and singular the goods, chattels and credits of the
said deceased, which have or shall come into your hands, possession or knowledge. Also to make
or cause to be made duplicates of such Inventory, and cause the same to be signed by the ap‐
praisers and the same so made and signed, that you make return thereof to the Surrogate of the
County of Madison within three months from the date hereof, and further to render a just and
true account of your administration when thereunto required.
In Testimony Whereof, we have caused the seal of our said
Surrogate's Court to be hereunto affixed.
Witness, ROSS PATANE, Esq., Surrogate of
our said County of Madison, at his office in Wampsville,
in said County, the 31st day of January,
in the year of our Lord one thousand nine hundred and
Sixty‐Three.
Clerk of the Surrogate's Court

STATE OF NEW YORK,
Madison County Surrogate’s Office
I, FREDERIC N. RANN, Clerk of the Surrogate’s Court of said County,
Do Hereby Certify, That on the 9TH day of JAN in the
year one thousand nine hundred SIXTY‐NINE Letters Testamentary of the Last
Will and Testament of PEARL M. MOSHER
late of the TOWN of HAMILTON in said county, deceased, were duly
granted and issued by the Surrogate’s Court of said County of Madison, to
FRED C. MOSHER & JERIL BENEDICT
and that the same are unrevoked of record and are in full force.
In Testimony Whereof, I have hereunto set my hand and affixed the seal of the
Surrogate’s Court of said County, at the Village of Wampsville, this 9TH day
of JAN A. D., 1969.
Frederic N. Rann
Clerk of the Surrogate's Court.
